page_analysis.text_content:
Driveway standards

• Driveway surfaces may have either
permeable or impermeable paving.
Materials shall meet Public Works
standards.

• Driveway surface within 10' of the
public right-of-way may not be of a
loose material e.g., gravel.

• 2nd dwelling units must share com-
mon driveway with main dwelling.

• Minimum driveway clearance: 10'
• Minimum driveway surface: 8'
• Minimum 20' between curb cuts.
• No more than 40% of required
front yard may be impermeable.
• Street-work permit required for
work done within the public right-
of-way.

For safety reasons, the city also encourages
that the following standard be met:

• No more than one curb cut per single
frontage.

• Minimum of 50' between curb cut and
intersection curb face.

Fig 31 Driveway standards

Pavers without mortar
(grass between) OK

"Hollywood strips"
(grass between) OK

Gravel OK

10'

Turns enroute to required
parking spaces must be
deemed manueverable by
the Transportation Division.

8' min. width for driveway
surface (typ. all)

10' min. width for driveway
clearance (typ. all)

No gravel or similar loose
materials within 10' of the
public right-of-way (lot line)

Work done within the public
ROW requires a street-work
permit and must comply with
city standards.

36

visual_elements.description: A series of three cross-sectional diagrams illustrating acceptable driveway surface types. From left to right: 1. 'Pavers without mortar (grass between) OK' showing individual paver blocks with grass in between, resting on a base. 2. '"Hollywood strips" (grass between) OK' showing two parallel strips of paving with grass in between, resting on a base. 3. 'Gravel OK' showing a gravel surface with a curved edge, resting on a base, with an underlying layer of a different material. This diagram also includes annotations for dimensions and conditions related to driveway design.

technical_specifications.parameter: Maximum impermeable area of required front yard
Minimum distance between curb cut and intersection curb face

additional_notes: Page number '36' is located at the bottom left corner.

qualifiers.text: For safety reasons, the city also encourages that the following standard be met:

conditions.text: Driveway surfaces may have either permeable or impermeable paving.
Materials shall meet Public Works standards.
Driveway surface within 10' of the public right-of-way may not be of a loose material e.g., gravel.
2nd dwelling units must share common driveway with main dwelling.
No more than 40% of required front yard may be impermeable.
Street-work permit required for work done within the public right-of-way.
No more than one curb cut per single frontage.
Minimum of 50' between curb cut and intersection curb face.
Turns enroute to required parking spaces must be deemed manueverable by the Transportation Division.
8' min. width for driveway surface (typ. all)
10' min. width for driveway clearance (typ. all)
No gravel or similar loose materials within 10' of the public right-of-way (lot line)
Work done within the public ROW requires a street-work permit and must comply with city standards.

execution_sequence.action: Evaluate driveway surface material and compliance with Public Works standards.
Check material type for driveway surface within 10' of public right-of-way.
Verify shared driveway for 2nd dwelling units.
Check minimum distance between curb cuts.
Evaluate impermeability of required front yard.
Verify street-work permit for work within public right-of-way.
Evaluate number of curb cuts per single frontage (encouraged standard).
Evaluate minimum distance between curb cut and intersection curb face (encouraged standard).
Ensure turns enroute to parking spaces are maneuverable by Transportation Division.
Verify typical minimum driveway surface width.
Verify typical minimum driveway clearance width.
Check for loose materials within 10' of public right-of-way (lot line).
Ensure work within public ROW has a street-work permit and complies with city standards.
